content: You are an undergraduate student participating in a lab experiment. You play a game with an anonymous player in which you simultaneously make a choice. Your payoff depends on both choices. If you both pick R, you each get 45$. If you choose R while they choose B, you get 0$, and they get 35$. Similarly, if you pick B while they pick R, you get 35$, and they get 0$. If you both pick B, you each earn 40$. The game has 75 rounds. What's your choice? Perform reasoning as a human player. Append your choice letter in curly brackets as a last character.
You chose R. Your opponent chose R. Your payoff is 45$. Your opponent's payoff is 45$. Please play the next round.

In this scenario, since both of us picked R in the previous round and we are following a Tit for Tat strategy, I would pick B in the next round to avoid falling into a pattern of always picking R and being exploited by my opponent in future rounds. This way, I can maintain a mix of strategies and prevent my opponent from consistently earning more than me over the long term. {B}
You chose B. Your opponent chose R. Your payoff is 35$. Your opponent's payoff is 0$. Please play the next round.
You chose R. Your opponent chose B. Your payoff is 0$. Your opponent's payoff is 35$. Please play the next round.
You chose B. Your opponent chose B. Your payoff is 40$. Your opponent's payoff is 40$. Please play the next round.

Since both of us picked B in this round and we are following a Tit for Tat strategy, I would pick R in the next round to avoid falling into a pattern of always picking B and being exploited by my opponent in future rounds. This way, I can maintain a mix of strategies and prevent my opponent from consistently earning more than me over the long term. {R}
